column2: A building block of a React application that encapsulates UI and logic.
JavaScript XML; a syntax extension that allows writing HTML-like code in JavaScript.
Short for properties; used to pass data from parent to child components.
An object that holds dynamic data in a component and triggers re-render when updated.
A JavaScript array method used in React to render lists by transforming array elements.
The structure of nested components in a React application.
Displaying multiple elements by iterating over data, often using map().
Functional components are simpler and use hooks; class components are older and use lifecycle methods.
Creating an instance of a React component using JSX syntax like <Component />.
A unique identifier for list elements in React to help with efficient rendering.
